result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benito Jose Cordero

records.addlTxt:
8:02 AM Defendant Benito Jose Cordero in court.  Attorney David Moss in court for Benito Jose Cordero.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. Interpreter, Susan Rascon, appears by ZOOM.
Court calls case.
8:04 AM off record.
8:06 AM back on record.
Interpreter is simultaneously interpreting to the Deft by phone - although she is appearing by ZOOM to the court.
Atty Moss provides plea form in both English and Spanish to the Court.
Atty Moss provides a copy of the DJA in both English and Spanish to the Court.
ADA heard on agreement.
Atty Moss agrees.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 1.
Deft enters a plea of guilty.
Non-citizen advisory.
Court informs of voting and firearms restrictions if found guilty of this charge.
Deft understands.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Elements of offense.
Atty Moss satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court accepts and approves the DJA.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea but withholds the finding of guilt, subject to the terms of the DJA.
8:38 AM

1:02 PM Defendant Benito Jose Cordero in court.  Attorney David Moss in court for Benito Jose Cordero.  Attorney Robert Mraz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Interpreter, Susan Rascon, sworn in.
Atty Moss heard - case is resolved.
Resolution involves a DPA and that will need to be drafted and reviewed with the Deft and interpreter.
1:04 off record.
1:06 back on record.
Court schedules with parties.
Interpreter confirms the date/time works with her schedule.
Interpreter will appear by Zoom.
State will provide the DJA to Atty Moss by next Monday, and he will take care of getting it translated.
1:08 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:00 am.

3:33 PM Defendant Benito Jose Cordero in court.  Attorney David Moss in court for Benito Jose Cordero.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Interpreter sworn in.
Atty Moss provides a prelim form.
Atty Moss confirms the form was completed with the help of the interpreter.
Court reviews form with Deft.
PrelimQues/WOR.
Deft waives prelim.
Atty Moss is satisfied.
Court finds deft freely waives prelim and binds over for trial.
3:37 Arraignment
Copy of information. 
ADA heard - information will track the complaint.
Atty Moss heard - waives a formal reading and enters not guilty plea.
Requests status.
3:38 off record.
3:42 back on record.
Court schedules with parties.
Interpreter confirms the date and time work with her schedule.
3:44 PM
Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Interpreter Susan Rascon for Prelim Waiver/Arraign on 06/14/22
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on June 14, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Order allowing Deft to reschedule preliminary waiver hearing
Motion to reschedule preliminary waiver hearing

11:40 AM Defendant Benito Jose Cordero in court.  Attorney David Moss in court for Benito Jose Cordero.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Interpreter, Susan Rascon, sworn in.
Copy of complaint.
Atty Moss heard - has reviewed with deft.
Deft understands charges and penalties.
Requests prelim and arriagnment.
Court schedules with parties.
Interpreter confirms the date and time will work with her schedule.
Court approves the interpreter to appear by ZOOM for the next hearing.
11:43 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Income withholding - $150/month beginning 06-01-22 towards dean fees
Dean Appt - Atty Moss: Repayment at $150/month beginning 06-01-2022.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
8:53 AM Defendant Benito Jose Cordero in court.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Interpreter, Susan Rascon, sworn in.
Court inquires on Atty.
Deft heard - does not have an attorney.
Has not contacted the PD's office yet.
Atty Hansen is present and is heard - will meet with deft and interpreter today.
ADA heard - at the last hearing, deft told the court he had hired Atty Seaborg.
Deft agrees.
Deft heard - was never able to get in touch with her to tell her of today's proceedings.
Court schedules with parties.
Interpreter confirms the date works with her schedule.
As additional condition of bail, deft must contact Atty Seaborg and retain her, or contact the PD no later than 4 pm on 05-10-22 to retain an atty.
If not completed and reported to the COC office, a bench warrant will be issued.
Deft understands.
9:03 AM
10:22 AM back on record.
Court calls case.
Court heard - deft does not qualify for PD and has completed Dean paperwork.
Deft provides dean paperwork to the court.
Deft sworn in.
Court reviews dean form with deft.
Deft to repay the County $150 per month beginning June 1, 2022 towards dean fees.
Atty Moss is present and is heard - will represent, pending a conflict check.
Court appoints Atty Moss to the case.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:01 AM Defendant Benito Jose Cordero in court.  Attorney DeShea Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Interpreter John Vaughn sworn in.
Deft heard - has hired Atty Seaborg, but she was unavailable today.
10:02 AM off record
10:03 back on record.
Court continues case to the next time the interpreter is here.
Court orders deft to contact the atty today and she must file a notice of appearance by May 3, 2022 and she must appear with him in person on May 9, 2022.
DA heard on bond form.
Clerk confirms signed bond form is in the file.
10:05 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

03:29 PM Defendant Benito Jose Cordero in court, in custody.  Kathryn E Heineck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court calls case.
Interpreter, Susan Rascon, sworn in.
Court reviews charge and max penalties.
Deft understands.
Court inquires on atty.
Deft understands that he may contact the Public Defender if he would like an atty.
3:33 off record for scheduling.
3:37 PM back on record.
Court heard and schedules with parties.
Interpreter confirms the date and time works with her schedule.
Deft to contact the Peshtigo Public Defender's office tomorrow.
ADA heard on bond.
Deft heard.
Court imposes $1000 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, deft must arrive 1 hour early for every scheduled court appearance, deft may only live in Marinette County while on bail, deft may not leave the State of Wisconsin for any reason.
ADA heard and requests deft's passport be surrendered.
Deft heard - does not have a passport.
Court discusses with Deft.
Deft understands.
ADA to make a bail from in Spanish so that he can sign it - Deft not allowed to bond out until he signs a Spanish bond form.
ADA to provide the Spanish bail form to the COC office, to then be faxed over to the jail.
3:45 PM
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

03:29 PM Defendant Benito Jose Cordero in court, in custody.  Kathryn E Heineck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Benito Jose Cordero appeared by video means.
Court calls case.
Deft heard - does not understand English well.
Cour addresses all parties that we will reschedule bail hearing for when an interpreter is present.
Court schedules.
3:30 PM
  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
